club.name: Leo Lions Club of Colombo Uptown Eminence
club.tagline: We Lead. We Serve. We Uplift.
club.description: A dynamic Leo club igniting youth leadership through service, creativity, and meaningful impact.

about.mission: To empower youth through leadership development and community service that creates lasting positive change.
about.vision: To be the leading youth organization fostering innovation, service, and excellence in everything we do.
about.values: Integrity, service, excellence, and collaboration guide every initiative we undertake.

clubCouncil.name: Leo Lion Anuk Nisalitha
clubCouncil.biography: Leo Lion Anuk Nisalitha is an accomplished environmental leader, scout, and emerging entrepreneur recognized for his vision, leadership, and commitment to meaningful change. A proud alumnus of Ananda College, he has distinguished himself through a blend of leadership, innovation, and an unwavering commitment to creating a greener and more compassionate world.
clubCouncil.background: From his formative years, Anuk demonstrated an innate ability to lead. His educational journey at Ananda College was marked by academic excellence and environmental activism. He served as President of the Ananda College Environmental Society (ACES), Secretary of the Marine Association, and Scout Group. As a Leo, he served as Assistant Secretary and Director Panelist, spearheading impactful initiatives. He is also a co-founder of sustainable enterprises aligning profitability with purpose.

clubCouncil.name: Leo Lion Vihandu Wanniarachchi
clubCouncil.biography: Vihandu Wanniarachchi serves as Vice President, supporting club operations and member development initiatives.
clubCouncil.background: Background in project management and youth leadership development.

clubCouncil.name: Leo Lion Thusal Ranawaka
clubCouncil.biography: Thusal Ranawaka serves as Secretary, managing communications and official club documentation.
clubCouncil.background: Strong organizational skills with experience in administrative management.

clubCouncil.name: Leo Lion Rinoshi Nihara
clubCouncil.biography: Rinoshi Nihara serves as Treasurer, overseeing financial management and budget planning.
clubCouncil.background: Financial management background with expertise in budget planning.

districtOfficials.name: Lion A.P. Singh
districtOfficials.biography: A.P. Singh, of Kolkata, India, was elected to serve as international president of Lions Clubs International at the association’s 107th international convention, held in Orlando, Florida from July 13 through July 17, 2025. He is a practicing chartered accountant and has family business interests in automobile dealerships.
districtOfficials.background: A Lion since 1984 and a member of the Calcutta Vikas Lions Club, he has held many positions including district governor and council chairperson. He has served as GMT international coordinator, chairperson for the 2017 DGE seminar, and faculty at numerous leadership institutes. He has also served as multi-national coordinator for Campaign SightFirst II and CA leader for Campaign 100.

districtOfficials.name: Lion Fabricio Oliveira
districtOfficials.biography: Fabrício Oliveira of Catolé do Rocha, Paraiba, Brazil, serves as chairperson for Lions Clubs International Foundation (LCIF). He is a businessman with a post-graduate degree in business management (MBA) from Fundação Getúlio Vargas (FGV) and a degree in business administration.
districtOfficials.background: A member of the Catolé do Rocha Lions Club since 1985, he has held numerous offices including international director and Multiple District LA first council of governors chairperson. Professionally, he has served as the secretary of industry and commerce of the state of Paraiba. He and his wife Amariles have two daughters, a son, and a granddaughter.

districtOfficials.name: Lion Shyana Jayalath
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Shyana Jayalath, Past District Governor and dynamic leadership voice within Lions International, currently serves as the Council Chairperson of Lions Multiple District 306 for 2025/2026. She makes history as the first Council Chair to lead the newly expanded 12-district Multiple District—a milestone in Sri Lankan Lions history.
districtOfficials.background: Her leadership journey began in the Leo movement and reached historic heights as President of the Lions Club of Colombo (Host), where she led the club to its first “Most Outstanding Club” award in six decades. As District Governor of 306A1, she reinvigorated the district with her theme “Believe in the Power of One.” Today, she leads with vision, action, and an element of fun.
achievements: First Council Chair of expanded MD 306
New Voices Global Winner in Marketing
Lady Lion of the Year for MD 306

districtOfficials.name: Lion Gaya Upasena
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Gaya Upasena serves as the District Governor for 306 D7. An acclaimed specialist in Power Generation, he is the Managing Director at Power Lanka Pvt Ltd, the local dealer for FG Wilson. He holds a bold vision of 'Building a Better Future'.
districtOfficials.background: Born in Maharagama, he is an alumnus of Dharmapala and Nalanda College. He holds a Diploma in Automobile Engineering from CGTTI and served 10 years at the Ministry of Defense, Oman. A Lion since 2012, he has served as Cabinet Secretary and spearheaded the development of the District Website and Mobile App.
achievements: Mastermind behind District online evaluation system

districtOfficials.name: Lion Ranjith Fernando
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Ranjith Fernando began his Lions journey while serving as a Branch Manager at Seylan Bank. Professionally, he built a distinguished career in banking, playing a key role in establishing the Leasing Unit at People’s Bank, before moving to Seylan Bank and later venturing into the printing and packaging industry as a successful entrepreneur.
districtOfficials.background: Academically, he holds a Bachelor of Commerce from the University of Sri Jayewardenepura, is an Associate Member of the Institute of Bankers, a finalist of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Sri Lanka, and has pursued further studies in Japan and India. He also served as President of MASCO 85 of his alma mater. His leadership extended into the printing industry, where he became President of the Sri Lanka Association of Printers and represented the country at international forums. In Lionism, he rose through the ranks with dedication, serving in many cabinet roles, and publishing four acclaimed books on leadership and Lions governance.
achievements: Leadership Medal from International President Douglas Alexander
Established Dialysis Center at KDU Hospital (Rs. 40 million)
Membership Hero Award & Membership Rockstar Award (2025)

districtOfficials.name: Lion Chandika Dedigama
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Chandika Dedigama supports the district's administration and prepares for future leadership.

districtOfficials.name: Lion Viduranga Maddumage
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Viduranga Maddumage plays a key role in district operations and member engagement.

projects.description: Digital Marketing Basics for Youth Entrepreneurs workshop equipping young minds with essential digital knowledge.

projects.name: Beach Cleanup
projects.title: Environmental Conservation
projects.description: Environmental sustainability project promoting coastal conservation at Wellawatta Beach.

projects.name: Ashirwada Pooja
projects.title: Blessings Ceremony
projects.description: Spiritually enriching ceremony at Asokaramaya Temple to invoke blessings for the club's future endeavors.

projects.name: Project Suwadivi

projects.description: Compassionate initiative renovating the Paralyzed Patients' Ward at Ayurvedic Hospital, Rajagiriya.
